div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 20:56 pm CDT

div.span: Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming mostly clear, with a low around 41. Calm wind becoming north northwest around 5 mph after midnight.
A 20 percent chance of showers after 4pm. Sunny, with a high near 66. Light and variable wind becoming west southwest 5 to 8 mph in the morning.

A chance of showers and thunderstorms before midnight, then a slight chance of showers between midnight and 1am. Mostly cloudy, then gradual clearing toward daybreak, with a low around 47. West wind 6 to 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%.

Student Lunch Survey
Top Stories
Continued Closure of Schools for In-Person Instruction Through the End of the 2019-2020 School Year
April 17, 2020
Dear Waltonville Parents and Guardians:
The governor announced today the continued closure of schools for in-person instruction through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. Remote learning will continue to take place through the remaining days of the school calendar.
While this is certainly not the news we were hoping to hear today, rest assured your teachers will . . .
read more
CHANGE IN MEAL TIMES, PACKET DISTRIBUTION, AND TEXTBOOK RETURN 4/13/2020
RE: CHANGE IN MEAL TIMES, PACKET DISTRIBUTION, AND TEXTBOOK RETURN
Dear Parents:
Due to the safety of our students and staff, we feel it is necessary to limit our meal program to Mondays only and pick up at the Grade School. No longer will we be offering bus delivery to bus stops. Meals will be given for one week at a time. So essentially, what a family will receive on a Monday . . .
read more
Social Distancing - What does it mean?
A key factor in lowering the pace and extent of the spread of COVID-19 is practicing social distancing. To help you efforts of promoting social distancing in your respective communities, here are some tips.
read more
Closure Update March 31, 2020 - Extending through April 30, 2020
March 31, 2020
Dear Parents:
I just wanted to reach out and thank you again for all your continued support and assistance during this time. As many of you have already heard, Governor Pritzker announced a continued “stay at home” order for the entire state until April 30. With this most recent executive order, the reopening date for schools statewide has been tentatively postponed to . . .
read more
WCUSD1 Remote Learning Plan
Parents:
Moving forward, the state has asked all schools to transition to what is known as Remote Learning Days. The teachers and administration have worked together to develop a remote learning plan to address the physical, mental, and overall wellness of your child. We understand the immense challenges this time has caused you and are doing everything we can to assist your child through it. . . .
read more
IHSA Spring Sports Updated from IHSA Executive Director Craig Anderson 3/25/2020
Parents and Students:
March 25 update on IHSA Spring Sports from IHSA Executive Director Craig Anderson:
IHSA Member School Administrators & Spring Sport Coaches,
I know this time continues to be a challenge for all of us. I hope this note finds you well.
As the IHSA staff and Board of Directors continue to monitor updates from government offices, as well as state and local health departments, we continue to . . .
read more
FFA Pork Chop Dinner/Raffle Postponed
The Waltonville Pork Chop Dinner/Raffle has been postponed and will NOT be held April 11! We will reschedule a date when the health crisis has past. If you have bought tickets they will be honored on the rescheduled date. Everyone stay home, stay safe, and we will get through this!
read more
